body:
### Problem

I have a deps.edn Clojure project and I want to jump into standard-library function sources using `vim.lsp.buf.definition`.

The sources are located in file
```
zipfile:///home/user/.m2/repository/org/clojure/clojure/1.11.1/clojure-1.11.1.jar::clojure/core.clj
```
So the editor has to open that zipfile, then open the file inside of it and seek to a line.

What happens is that first I see this message:

![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/1641263/c8d01bdf-7753-4a5c-9e86-30413ca20943)

Then I press Enter and see the source file at line 0:
![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/1641263/53579831-f134-4c6c-b1be-a93585f0c6bc)

Then if I go back to the previous source file and activate `vim.lsp.buf.definition` again.
But now the location in the file is correct (I tried to jump into function `fnil`):
![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/1641263/78d16108-ddcc-40b0-8e47-81a2b0087700)


And then I can type `:filetype detect` and suddenly the syntax highlighting works properly (both: LSP and non-LSP one):
![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/1641263/afaf8c0c-5944-420a-ae01-075854488dbc)


### Steps to reproduce

If possible I wouldn't want to produce the config. 

### Expected behavior

Expected: 
The highlighting and the line number should be picked up even if the buffer was not encountered from before.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.9.2

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

I didn't test

### Operating system/version

6.1.55-1-MANJARO

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.29.2

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

system package manager
title: Jumping into a file inside of a JAR ZIPfile doesn't run Autocommands
